title: Googlesheet, conditionnal formatting in a table using the values of another table?
body:
I am currently working on a spreadsheet.

I have one table containing winrates of certain games, this table is 20x20. These winrates are calculated with datas of games played, which I also organized in 20x20. Both tables are related in that the same (x,y) coordinate in each table corresponds to the same type of game played.

What I want is to color the cells of my winrate table according to how accurate the results are. For example, the (2;6) square might show a percentage of 60% winrate but based on only 3 games (which is the value we can find in the second table at (2;6).

I can write a set of rules that can color the (2;6) cell of the winrate table correctly depending on the value of the (2;6) cell of the "games played" table without a problem. My problem is that I can't find how to expand this formula to the whole table. When I do, the whole winrate table has its formatting based on the (2;6) coordinate of the second table.

I tried different things: Conditionnal formating, applied to range "C30" format cells if "custom formula is" =(C54)<5 Conditionnal formating, applied to range "C30:V49" format cells if "custom formula is" =(C54:V73)<5

as well as applying to whole table and custom formula to a single cell, or applying to a single cell and custom formula to whole other table. Is it even possible to not have to type manually all the formatting to each cell? I mean, there should be a way to not have to manually edit 5 rules on 400 cells right?
